definition: to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to shout loudly/to raise a cry/to yell
shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
lit. people shouting and horses neighing (idiom)/fig. tumultuous/hubbub

sentences.english: He shouted and rapped with his walking stick on the door.
sentences.chinese: 他边喊着边用拐杖敲着门。

sentences.english: And you are saying wait a minute, he has violated the Pauli Exclusion Principle.
sentences.chinese: 你们有人在喊我停一下，说我违反了保利不相容原理。

sentences.english: He beckoned Natasha, and asked her what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 他把娜塔莎喊来，并且问她这是怎么回事。

sentences.english: Don't chant things like "loser" or taunt them when they lose.
sentences.chinese: 不要反复喊着“失败者”或者奚落他们。

sentences.english: Du Niang met with the woman shouted, Zuitian points good work.
sentences.chinese: 见了女的喊大娘，嘴甜点好办事。

sentences.english: Only stupidest cry and fools die .
sentences.chinese: 只有傻瓜蠢蛋才会哭着喊着要去死。
他大声喊着，“别把这孩子带走。

sentences.english: These are addressed to our training company commander Liu often shouted words.
sentences.chinese: 以上都是刘连长在给我们训练时常喊的话。

sentences.english: He was running along the road; I called to him, but he wouldn't come back.
sentences.chinese: 他沿着马路跑啦，我喊他，可是他不回来。

sentences.english: The children in the audience were shouting at Snow White, warning her not to eat the apple.
sentences.chinese: 观众中的孩子都朝她喊，提醒她不要吃苹果。
林惇从大门口那儿喊着。

sentences.english: She was yelling now, as the train's bellow grew louder.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎是在喊，火车的轰鸣声越来越响了。

sentences.english: When winter came, the grasshopper had nothing, but the ant complained of chest pains.
sentences.chinese: 到了冬天，蚱蜢一无所有，可是蚂蚁却喊胸口疼。

sentences.english: Then none day, he shouted tala three times and forced me out of the house.
sentences.chinese: 然后有一天，他喊了三声塔拉格，把我赶出房子。

sentences.english: The next is to point dish and call for drinks.
sentences.chinese: 接下来是点菜肴，喊酒水。

sentences.english: Santa shouted out the reindeers' names and cracked his whip.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞老人喊出驯鹿的名字，猛抽他的鞭子。

definition: to shout loudly/to raise a cry/to yell
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to roar/to howl/to shriek/roar or howl of an animal/bellow of rage
to raise one's voice/to speak at the top of one's voice
to cry out/to bark out a sound
shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
